page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content:
The ancient town of Conwy has long been an obstacle to would-be invaders of the territory of Gwynedd. Modern invaders fare even worse than their predecessors,for Conwy is an infamous traffic{bottleneck}making Gwynedd as hard to leave as it is to enter. { The long-suffering residents look forward to the Conwy River Tunnel as a means of restoring the Medieval peace and atmosphere of this tranquil place.The{Castle},built by Edward 1st in 1283, dominates the town which grew around it.The walls are an extension of the castle's defences and form the shape of a harp which is appropriate to Welsh folklore.
Information supplied by pupils of ABERCONWY SCHOOL and I Harrison (Head of Computing)
